L2_gloss: A fenced pen in a goat shed for the young goats and lambs.
A key made of a long wire.
The valley of Achuaga, between Rumbur and Bumboret.
To dry up, especially from evaporation and age.
A hook; among other things these are used to lift the griddle off the fire and hang it up. It is commonly made from a forked branch.

A ceremony celebrating birth. This is performed five or six days after a birth. After purifying the mother with water and juniper smoke, girls take burning branches from the fire and run to the temple of Jestak, make a bonfire and jump over the flames shouting, "a'chambi a." It is called tus'ul'ek in Bumburet. It is known by this name only in Rumbur.
The wedge which holds the ploughshare in place.
To blow up, cause to swell, inflate.
some (of a larger group), a few

this, this present, this current.
aj bason.This spring.
The place where Kalasha women are relegated during menstruation and childbirth (because of 'impurity')
wooden beam used for supporting roofs
a breeze or a light wind
blind for hiding behind while hunting or fighting
mountain top, peak, succession of peaks which make
a seed, kernel or pit of fruits like a peach or an
The god of creation in Kalash religion.

The demon-like counterpart of Indra in Kalasha mythology. He appears on earth as a dog; the devalog throw stones at him (shooting stars).
